thread.section_title: Finance & Economy – News from shipping finance, major banks and the world economy
thread.title: Sinotrans issues profit warning

author: shippingherald.com
title: Sinotrans issues profit warning
text:
Chinese owner Sinotrans issued a profit warning to shareholders predicting lower earnings or loss in first half due to the weak dry bulk market.
The announcement reads:
This announcement is made by the Company pursuant to Rule 13.09(2)(a) of the Listing Rules and Part XIVA of the SFO.
The Board wishes to inform the shareholders of the Company and potential investors that after the preliminary review of the unaudited consolidated management accounts of the Group for the six months ended 30 June 2015, the net profit of the Group for the six months ended 30 June 2015 is expected to record a substantial decrease as compared to that for the same period in 2014 and may even record a considerable loss.
The information contained in this announcement is only a preliminary assessment by the management of the Company based on currently available information and such information has not been audited or reviewed by the Company’s auditor.
Shareholders of the Company and potential investors should exercise caution when dealing in the securities of the Company.
